info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 5:20PM EDT until August 06 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Davie County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... North central Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 520 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mocksville, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Cooleemee, Harmony, Fork Church, Sheffield, Farmington, Woodleaf, Turnersburg, Olin and Cool Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
